title: Sectional Mock 10 - English
instruction: In each of the statement given below, three blanks have been given followed by a set of six words. In the options, following the set of words, possible arrangement of words have been given which could fill the blanks in the same order as given in the options. Pick the set of words which could appropriately fit in the given blanks. If none of the given sets fit in the same order, choose (E), ‘none of these’, as your answer.

quiz.text: Why do companies need to develop Digital Business Agility (DBA)?
options: to collect anonymous feedbacks from employees
grasp new market possibilities
riposte successfully to the upcoming risks to their business
both [b] and [c]
none of these

quiz.text: How can companies achieve the process of informed decision making?
options: gleaning insights about what customers value from frontline sales associates
decisions must hinge on authentic data instead of former happenings
capturing frank assessments of corporate strategy from the people
both [a] and [b]
none of these

quiz.text: How can companies achieve better cognizance of their business environment?
options: focusing on employee productivity and organizational simplicity
monitoring changes in physical assets of the company from customers, employees, partners, etc
making big, strategic decisions that shape a company’s future but are not discussed openly
gaining insights from all the possible links of the company including employees and competitors
none of these

quiz.text: What can be the possible outcome if the functionaries within the organization divert higher attention towards workforce management?
options: help uncover hidden patterns of work
help analyzing its communications data
counter digital disruptors and foster new value for consumers
reveal exactly how organizations operate
all of these

quiz.text: Which of the following words is similar to “CORRESPOND”, as highlighted in the above passage?
options: quadrate
commensurate
correlate
analogous
all of these

quiz.text: Which of the following words is similar to ‘ ATTUNED’, as highlighted in the above passage?
options: indurate
congeal
stipulation
acclimatize
all of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is not true as per the information given in the above passage?
options: A company which does not heed the lesson of its failures is liable to attain success
DAT can help Nestle gain ambassadors among its customer base
In case of acceptance of supposition by management of company without any doubt or query might lead to failure of the company
Company’s agility is based on its level of awareness, decision making and execution.
All are correct

quiz.text: Identify the grammatical error in the italicized statement (I), given in the passage above. If there is no error in the statement, mark (e), ‘no error’, as your answer.
options: These combine people, business process changes and
technology to give voice to employee insights,
apply analytics to the point of decision, and identification
and allocate talent to execute the decisions as efficiently as possible
no error

quiz.text: Which statement is correct?1. From 1975 she was certified clinically insane and sent to a mental hospital.2. Since 1975 she was certified clinically insane and sent to a mental hospital.3. In 1975 she was certified clinically insane and sent to a mental hospital.4. On 1975 she was certified clinically insane and sent to a mental hospital.5. In 1975 she was certified clinical insane and sent to a mental hospital.
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: Which statement is correct? 1. It also allegation that the crop insurance scheme of the government had benefited private insurance companies more than the farmers.  2. Money was taken away from the bank accounts of farmers without their consent.  3. PV Sindhu on Saturday bowed out of the All England Badminton Championship after lossing an epic semi-final against Japan's Akane Yamaguchi. 4. PV Sindhu had eked out a thrilling three-game victory under 2016 champion Nozomi Okuhara of Japan. 5. Chennaiyin FC lifted their game to a level befitting the occasional and sent fancied Bengaluru FC crushing to a painful 2-3 defeat.
options: 2
4
1
5
3

quiz.text: Choose the statement from among the given options that is grammatically correct.1. Politeness was not always the sign of wisdom.2. Optimists always picture themself accomplishing their goals. 3. One cannot always be a hero, but one is always be a man.4. When a man is going down-hill, everyone will give him a push. 5. The worst men often gives the best advice
options: 2
5
1
4
3

quiz.text: Which statement is correct?1. India issued another note verbale to Pakistan on the continued harassment of Indian High Commission officials2. Pakistan said it would skip a World Trade Organisation (WTO) ministerial meeting in Delhi to beginning Monday3. Sources also said Islamabad would not send High Commissioner Sohail Mahmood back to Delhi until the diplomatic row was not resolved.4. Pakistani diplomatic sources has also said on Saturday that there would be no representation at the WTO meeting from the Delhi mission either.5. Besides, he asked farmers to grow more oil seeds to reduce dependents on imported cooking oil and cut urea consumption by at least half by 2022.
options: 5
2
4
1
3

quiz.text: Which statement is correct?1. Public demonstrations resort to violence, including stone-throwing, are not protected by the fundamental right to free speech and expression.2. Justice Bhushan, who wrote the judgement, observed that the Constitution only protects the right to assemble peacefully.3. A Bench of Justice A.K. Sikri and Ashok Bhushan observed that the reason for the demonstration might be genuine.4. A demonstration may take various forms, it may be noisy and disorder.5. The judgment came on a plea by Bimal Gurung for protection against arrest in several cases filed for him by the West Bengal government.
options: 2
4
5
1
3

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the FIRST sentence after rearrangement?
options: B
C
E
A
D

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the SECOND sentence after rearrangement?
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the FOURTH sentence after rearrangement?
options: C
E
A
B
F

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the FIFTH sentence after rearrangement?
options: D
F
E
B
C

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the SIXTH sentence after rearrangement?
options: C
B
E
A
F

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the THIRD sentence after rearrangement?
options: C
B
E
A
F

quiz.text: Which word comes in the blank labelled A?
options: Segregating
Paramount
Radically
Feebly
No improvement

quiz.text: Which word comes in the blank labelled B?
options: Underrated
Accelerated
Merged
Portly
No improvement

quiz.text: Which word comes in the blank labelled C?
options: Elegy
Evanescent
Demeanors
Facets
No improvement

quiz.text: Which word comes in the blank labelled D?
options: Garrulous
Hapless
Complementary
Inimical
No improvement

quiz.text: Which word comes in the blank labelled E?
options: Harness
Instigate
Inure
Obfuscate
No improvement

quiz.text: Who have much higher stakes in successful operations of private commercial banks?
options: Depositors
Creditors
Shareholders
Governments
Moneylenders

quiz.text: Why has the security enjoyed by depositors weakened under the present system of private ownership of banks?
options: Any loan given out can be recalled as per the whims of bank owners.
The rate of interest has drastically reduced under private bank ownership.

The ownership and control of bank finances rest with a small group of people, who can determine allocation and investment patterns as per individual interests, thereby affecting the general depositor in the long run.
The ownership having become public has increased the interest rates for the depositors.

The ownership and control of bank finances rests with a large group of people who can determine allocation and investment patterns as per individual interests, thereby affecting the general depositor in the long run.

quiz.text: Why has the security enjoyed by depositors weakened under the present system of private ownership of banks?
options: Any loan given out can be recalled as per the whims of bank owners.
The rate of interest has drastically reduced under private bank ownership.

The ownership and control of bank finances rest with a small group of people, who can determine allocation and investment patterns as per individual interests, thereby affecting the general depositor in the long run.
The ownership having become public has increased the interest rates for the depositors.

The ownership and control of bank finances rests with a large group of people who can determine allocation and investment patterns as per individual interests, thereby affecting the general depositor in the long run.

quiz.text: Choose the correct meaning of the word ‘encouragement‘ as highlighted in the paragraph.
options: Cheering
Pepping
Invigorating
Incitement
Supportive

quiz.text: What is best ensured under a nationalized banking system?
options: Higher interests rates translating to more profits for shareholders in banks.
In case of failure, depositors would have first claim on bank resources and not the owners of share capitals.
In case of failure, owners of share capital would have first claim on bank resources and not the depositors.
In case of failure, government will be able to bail out the bank in distress.
Lower interest rates translating to more profits for depositors in banks.

quiz.text: We may have reached peak __________ and cheap prices, and might now be entering a world of more targeted_____________, with less geographic coverage, _____________ in order turnaround and perhaps even higher prices – all of which will slow the growth curve. (i) competitive (ii) convenience (iii) offerings (iv) implementing (v) coverage (vi) variations
options: (v), (iv), (i)
(i), (iii), (v)
(ii), (v), (vi)
(iii), (i), (iv)
none of these
